press for: If you press for something, you try hard to persuade some to give it to you or to agree to it.
little more than: You use little more than to show something is only to a small degree.
substitute for: If one thing substitutes for another, it takes the place or performs the function of the other thing.
be rooted in: If you say a particular quality is rooted in something, that quality has an origin or base from that thing.
insofar as: You use insofar as to say to the extent or degree.
in the long run: You use in the long run to suggest some time in the future.
hold in check: If you hold something in check, you keep something or someone under control, usually to stop them becoming too large or too powerful.
or so: You use or so when you are giving an approximate amount.
in conjunction with: If one thing is done or used in conjunction with another, the two things are done or used together.
